messages.title: The Lib Dem difference
messages.content: The Liberal Democrats will take action to protect frontline NHS services.

messages.title: Four steps to a fairer Britain
messages.content: Fair taxes, fair chance for every child, a fair future by creating jobs and making Britain greener, and a fair deal from politicians.

messages.title: ...but is this the kind of change we want?
messages.content: References to opposing party leaders and their policies, questioning if their changes are what people want.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Cutting taxes by £700, specifically aiming to take the poorest workers out of the tax system.
Smaller class sizes, more money into schools, and abolishing university tuition fees.
Create jobs by making Britain greener, investing in public transport, renewable energy, and energy-efficient homes.
Make politicians accountable and give the right to sack corrupt MPs.

mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: References to David Cameron suggesting negative implications of their policies.

issues.economy: Pledges to balance the country's books and identify real savings to pay for it.
issues.education: Smaller class sizes, more investment in schools, abolishing tuition fees.
issues.environment: Create jobs by investing in renewable energy and energy-efficient homes.
issues.governance: Political accountability and power to remove corrupt MPs.

quotes.text: We will put more police on patrol, restore the pensions earnings link, and deliver fair pay for the armed forces.
The proposal to take the poorest workers out of the tax system is especially overdue.
The party is also pledging to raise tax thresholds to £10,000 a year, taking four million people out of Income Tax.
It's time for real change and honesty in politics again.

images.caption: Photos of Nick Clegg with supporters, and Vince Cable, along with quotes and headlines from the campaign.
